node.title: UK to push for safe exit for Afghans as US leaves
node.description: The international community will "push as one voice" for the safe passage of Afghans, the PM says.

node.title: US ends two-decade presence in Afghanistan
node.description: The US military's last C17 aircraft left Kabul with the ambassador on board early on Tuesday.

node.title: Leaded petrol now eradicated worldwide, says UN
node.description: The highly polluting fuel has contaminated the atmosphere, water and crops for nearly a century.

node.title: Fleeing the Taliban over land into Pakistan

node.title: The students amassing degrees to stay in Europe

node.title: Afghan left behind by UK: I'm fighting to stay alive

node.title: UK urges cooperation on safe exit for Afghans
node.description: The foreign secretary wants international support to ensure the Taliban allow people to leave.

node.title: Covid crisis in Aboriginal communities causes fury
node.description: Indigenous Australians say surging infections in remote areas should have been prevented.

node.title: EU set to impose Covid travel restrictions on US
node.description: The European Union is set to recommend barring American travellers as US hospital admissions peak.

node.title: Ex-marine 'embarrassed' by expletive-laden message

node.title: China cuts children's online gaming to one hour
node.description: Regulators are restricting game-playing for under 18s to an hour on Fridays, weekends and holidays

node.title: Afghan interpreter's family to come to Ireland

node.title: Rescuer working to make Haiti earthquake town safe

node.title: Rockets fired at Afghanistan's Kabul airport
node.description: It comes a day before a deadline for the complete withdrawal of US troops from the country.

node.title: Australia records 1,000th Covid death
node.description: The country has fared better than many nations but is seeing more infections than ever before.

node.title: Vietnam adds to global coffee supply concerns
node.description: Wholesale coffee prices have risen by 50% this year as supplies have been hit around the world.

node.title: India's Avani Lekhara wins gold at Paralympics
node.description: Avani Lekhara has become the first Indian woman to win a Paralympics gold medal.

node.title: NZ woman dies after receiving Pfizer vaccine

node.title: UK pressure over Taliban safe passage pledge
node.description: The government is seeking international support to ensure the militants allow people to leave Afghanistan.

node.title: North Korea appears to restart nuclear reactor
node.description: A UN report says the reactor, which can produce plutonium for weapons, has been active since July.

node.title: Cost of war threatens Ethiopia's economic gains

node.title: Louisiana hunkers down as Hurricane Ida strikes

node.title: New destinations added to NI travel green list

node.title: Japan's huge army of under-employed ex-housewives

node.title: Campaigners call on India to outlaw marital rape

node.title: Lou Grant and Up actor Ed Asner dies aged 91
node.description: He'll be remembered for his roles as TV newsman Lou Grant and the lead voice role in Pixar hit Up.

node.title: Reggae icon Lee 'Scratch' Perry dies aged 85

node.title: Drone strike thwarts Kabul airport attack, US says

node.title: NI naval officer's relief as Afghan family rescued

node.title: Late actor's last film to premiere in her hometown

node.title: Covid in India - children have forgotten how to read

node.title: 'Overwhelming' response to refugee donation call

node.title: Afghan Uyghurs fear 'double danger' under the Taliban

node.title: Biden vows to complete evacuations despite attacks

node.title: Afghanistan crisis: What is Isis-K?
